channel.title: Hosting Issues Please Help
channel.description:
Ok I have had continuous hosting issues for the server I am trying to release. So I am going to break it down bit by bit, and hope that this wonderful community can please help me with my problem that I have tried resolving for about a week now by myself.
I am trying to host my 562 server. I have done the following...
1. I have went to no-ip.com and made an account. 2. I have downloaded the DUC v3.0.4 3. I have made an ip for my server "fatalpkers.no-ip.biz" to be precise. <-- added to hosts and checked it in the DUC. 4. I went into my Linksys Cisco router -> Application and Gaming -> Port Range Forwarding (I'm pretty sure it goes here, but there is also Single Port Forwarding.) I added the title RSPS > External/ Internal Ports both 43594 > Protocol "Both" > To IP Address "My IPv4" > and Enabled, Saved. 5. I went into my source and changed the IP "127.0.0.1" to "fatalpkers.no-ip.biz" in the following files = ClientSettings.Java, Applet_Sub1, and ServersList. (There may be more but I have not managed to find anymore IP inputs.) 6. Compiled with no errors and ran my server. - AND STILL IT WILL NOT WORK. PLEASE HELP - I will be willing to Team View, but only to a trusted member. (Dealing with IP and such makes me nervous :p )
Please Help Me

item.title: Hosting Issues Please Help
item.dc:creator: @ImmensePK ImmensePK
item.description:
@ImmensePK wrote:

Have you changed the serverip in client files?

Also, try turning off your firewall and then try canyouseeme

Warning Turning off your firewall is not considered “safe” and can leave your computer vunerable to attack, please take precautions when turning it off.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Issues Please Help
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

It said error connection timed out ? when i checked it

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Issues Please Help
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

Go to http://canyouseeme.org/ and check if your port is online.

If it says something like

Error: I could not see your service on **.**.**.* on port (43594) Reason: Connection refused

Then you did something wrong while portforwarding. Also, check if your firewall is allowing the port.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Issues Please Help
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

Ok I have had continuous hosting issues for the server I am trying to release. So I am going to break it down bit by bit, and hope that this wonderful community can please help me with my problem that I have tried resolving for about a week now by myself.

I am trying to host my 562 server. I have done the following…

  1. I have went to no-ip.com and made an account.
  2. I have downloaded the DUC v3.0.4
  3. I have made an ip for my server “fatalpkers.no-ip.biz” to be precise. <-- added to hosts and checked it in the DUC.
  4. I went into my Linksys Cisco router -> Application and Gaming -> Port Range Forwarding (I’m pretty sure it goes here, but there is also Single Port Forwarding.) I added the title RSPS > External/ Internal Ports both 43594 > Protocol “Both” > To IP Address “My IPv4” > and Enabled, Saved.
  5. I went into my source and changed the IP “127.0.0.1” to “fatalpkers.no-ip.biz” in the following files = ClientSettings.Java, Applet_Sub1, and ServersList. (There may be more but I have not managed to find anymore IP inputs.)
  6. Compiled with no errors and ran my server.
  • AND STILL IT WILL NOT WORK. PLEASE HELP
  • I will be willing to Team View, but only to a trusted member. (Dealing with IP and such makes me nervous )

Please Help Me

Read full topic
